metadata.dc:description: BACKGROUND To know the prevalence of emotional disorders in a working population. SUBJECTS AND METHOD Workers in four companies: construction (A), automobile components (B), electrical and electronic systems (C) and management services (D). The design of the study was cross-sectional with the GHQ-28 questionnaire. RESULTS The prevalence fluctuated between 8,4% (A) and 24,0% (D). Sex, age, educational level and occupation showed significance differences in some companies. CONCLUSIONS The results suggest an important prevalence of emotional disorders that likely increase as there will be more firms of services.
